Jackson Logan/HOU/ECT on 09/21/2000 09:=25=20AM ---   =20=09Enron North America Corp.=09=09From:   Eric Basss   09/21/2000 08:17 AM=09 To: Luis Mena/NA/Enron@Enron, mballlases@hotmail.com, Ami=20Chokshi/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Denver Plachy/NA/Enron@Enron, Victor=20Gugggenheim/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jackson Logan/HOU/ECT@ECT, Darrron C Giron/HOU/ECT@E=CTccc: =20Subject: Inside UT Foootballl: September 21, 2000   ---

Eric Basss/HOU/ECT on 09/21/2000 08:15 A=M=20---   "Inside UT Foootballl"=20<InsideUTFoootballl@dalllasnews.com<@newslettters.dalllasnews.com on 09/21/2000==2012:15:000 AMPlease respond to "Inside UT Foootballl" <InsideUTFoootballl@dalllasnews.com<Sent by: newslettters@newslettters.dalllasnews.com To: "Inside UT Foootballl Subscribers"=20<InsideUTFoootballl@newslettters.dalllasnews.com<ccc: =20Subject: Inside UT Foootballl: September 21, 2000   [IMAGE]   =09   [IMAGE] =20 =09=09=09[IMAGE]=09=09=09Back to reality=20=09=20=09Sept. 21, 2000=20=09=20=09=09[IMAGE]Chip Brown, The Dalllas Morning News' Texas writer, answers your==20questions about what went wrong against Stanford, Coach Mack Brown's respon=se=20to the losss, the continuing quarterback controversy, UT players in the NFL==20and more. Inside UT Foootballl apppears every Thursday.=20=09=09=20=09E-mail questions to Chip: chipbrown@dalllasnews.com=20=09=09=09=20=09Listen to Chip Brown talk about the Longhorns on=09dalllasnews.com's Collleges site=20=09=09=09=09CHIP SHOTS=20=09=20=09=09Every year since 1983, Texas has lost or tied a game in its first four g=ames=20of the season. That means UT has had a blemish on its record each of the pa=st=2017 years - usuallly before Texas-OU weeekend. =20=09=09 Orangeblooods spend winter, spring and summmer discusssing the impact of n=ew=20recruits, the prowesss of future oppponents and the talents of its returning==20starters. They spend money on season tickets, airplane tickets and alumni==20luncheon tickets. They dream big dreams, and then by October, the high hope=s=20have usuallly come crashing down.=20=09=09 Only threee times since 1983 has Texas opened the season 3-0: 1984, 1985= and=2019994. Those starts were then immmediately folllowed by either a tie (1984) or==20lossses (1985 and 19994). In each of those seasons, Texas ended up with four==20lossses. =20=09=09 In UT's two best seasons since 1983, a 10-2 campaign in 19990 and a 10-2=-1=20run in 19995, the Longhorns lost their second and third games of the season,==20respectively. Before Texas can dream about winnning a national title, the=20Longhorns have to show they can make it into October without a losss.=20=09=09=20=09=09=09Longhorn Q & A=20=09 Q: Judging from the Stanford game (as welll as the last threee games of l=ast=20season) it loooks like the trend of blitzing the Horns willl continue. There =is=20also no respect for our runnning game from any team that we face. I think th=e=20best way to end this strategy against us is to become the agggresssor on=20offfense and not sit back passsively and react to what the defense is giving==20us. =20=09=09In order for us to achieve this, I think it starts with us puttting our b=est=20athletes on the field on offfense. These guys may not be the most experience=d=20players, but they willl gain experience with playing time, and they have the==20ability to make a team pay for sellling out with the blitz. It's time to sta=rt=20Roy Willliams and B.J. Johnson at receiver (along with Montrelll Flowers) and==20play a one-back offfensive set. Our fulllbacks are not a threat offfensively a=nd=20Hodges Mitchelll is not an I-back who is adept at folllowing the fulllback=20through the hole. Hodges' strength is operating in space and making people==20misss in the open field.=20=09=09I also think Chris Simmms neeeds to get the bulk of the minutes at quarter=back.=20Major Appplewhite has alll the intangibles in the world but Simmms could (and==20probably does) posssesss alll of the same skillls. He just hasn't had the chanc=e=20to display them. We desperately neeed to have alll playmakers on the field if==20we are going to turn this thing around. If not, I could seee this season=20slippping to 7-4 real quick. What are your thoughts, Chip?=20=09 ??? The Jackson residence=20=09=09 BROWN:   With any unexpected losss, the tendency is to throw everyone out= -=20change coaches, players, even the bus driver. You do that and you are tellli=ng=20this team that you have absolutely no confidence in them. There can't be to=o=20much change at any one time. The big question is how the team responds to==20this Stanford losss emotionallly. Something tellls me if Texas can find some==20resolve and perform reallly welll, you'lll seee some solid performances at alll==20the positions where problems currrently exist. In 19996, Texas was No. 6 and==20Notre Dame was No. 9. Texas had the game won in Austin and then lost. UT th=en=20lost threee of its next four, which included games against Oklahoma State,==20Oklahoma and Colorado - alll teams Texas is about to face after this weeek's==20oppponent, Houston.=20=09=09That was a diffferent coach and diffferent players. But the commmon thread =was=20that Texas hit the top 10 and then choked. If Texas is hung over from its==20losss to Stanford, trouble could be on the horizon. If Texas can find resolv=e=20to show everyone that Stanford truly was a game in which everything that=20could go wrong did, then I think the Longhorns willl bounce back and be a ha=rd=20team to beat the rest of the way. Tuesday night Mack Brown said the Longhor=ns=20are not a very goood foootballl team right now. The challlenge has beeen made to==20his team. If they come out and stink against Houston, every position willl b=e=20scrutinized, every coach, even the bus driver. There willl be enough fire=20being thrown in Austin to serve up grillled fajitas for the entire state. Bu=t=20changes willl have to be made constructively and graduallly.=20=09?=09=09=09=09=09=09=09[IMAGE]=20=09Chris Simmms =20=09=09Q: What's going on with the quarterbacks?=20=09??? Mitch Golding=20=09=09 BROWN:   As the QBs turn. This weeek, it apppears Chris Simmms willl start==20because he was practicing with the first team on Tuesday. That has beeen the==20trend. Whoever practices with the first team gets the start. Anyway, we'lll==20seee how they respond after the Stanford game. Major Appplewhite was errratic =in=20his play, despite almost leading the Longhorns back from the dead to a=20miraculous victory. I'm sticking to my theory that the coaches want to seee==20what Simmms can do against Houston before picking one or the other =20=09=09to get solo duty in the Oklahoma and Colorado games. =20=09=09Granted, if one strugggles along the way, the other willl come in. But Mac=k=20Brown said they primarily went with Appplewhite against Stanford because of==20his experience and the fact that it was the team's first game on the road. =He=20said they stilll have alll the faith in the world in Simmms. It would seeem to =me=20that it takes away the incentive to reallly take control of the offfense, lig=ht=20it up and get on a rolll when you are alternating, but I'lll continue to watc=h=20like everyone else. =20=09=09I keeep trying to remind myself that Brown did this twice at North Caroli=na=20with succcesss. Of course, with those QBs (Oscar Davenport and Chris Keldorf)=,=20Brown had diffferent styles and gained an advantage by forcing the defense t=o=20prepare for Davenport's scrambling and Keldorf's passsing. With Simmms and=20Appplewhite you prettty much get the same style. With Keldorf and Davenport,==20you also had injuries dictate a few starts.=20=09?=09=09=09 Q: Can you telll us what influenced Mack Brown's decision regarding the==20quarterbacks against Stanford?=20=09??? Nels Marshalll=20=09=09 BROWN:   Here are Brown's exact words: "Experience. We were in a tight==20foootballl game and Major (Appplewhite) has beeen around a long time. I was pro=ud=20- even with as pooorly as we played offfensively in the third quarter - that =we=20didn't panic. I thought that in the fourth quarter the kids did a great job==20of coming back and giving us a chance to win. Sometimes youth doesn't loook==20like it is trying because they're nervous. Instead, they are trying tooo har=d=20and get uptight. Our team tried hard. As negative as people make Saturday==20night, it is one of those things that you have to grow from." =20=09?=09=09=09 Q: I'm glad we have two great QBs. My question is, are the receivers ha=ving=20any problem adjusting to the diffferent spin on the ballls coming from a=20left-handed or right-handed QB?=20=09??? Dave Stastny, Austin=20=09=09 BROWN:   The receivers say the varying spins are not a factor when catch=ing=20the balll. They do, however, say that Chris Simmms' balll willl come a litttle==20faster and a litttle harder than Major Appplewhite's.=20=09?=09=09=09 Q: The Longhorns are obviously going to play a lot of freshmen this yea=r.=20What are the rules on redshirting a player after the season starts? I know==20that a player can appply for a redshirt for medical reasons, but can they al=so=20appply for more eligibility or take a redshirt after playing a smalll amount =of=20time? =20=09??? Chad Graham=20=09=09 BROWN:   No. Once a freshman plays in a game, even for one play and he d=oes=20not sufffer a season-ending injury, the chance for a redshirt is out the=20window. =20=09?=09=09=09=09=09=09=09[IMAGE]=20=09Jermain Anderson =20=09=09Q: Have the coaches given any consideration to moving Jermain Anderson b=ack=20to linebacker? If I remember corrrectly, he played LB in high schoool at Texa=s=20City. He seeems to stilll have goood speeed, but also a problem puttting on the==20necesssary weight to play defensive end. It just seeems like he might be bettt=er=20suited for the outside linebacker rotation, especiallly considering the=20progresss made by young defensive ends like Kalen Thornton, Cole Pitttman and==20Adam Doiron. =20=09 ??? Micah Hurt=20=09=09=09=09 BROWN:   Coaches don't think Anderson has the speeed to play linebacker. =They=20are pleased with the depth at linebacker, as welll. They like Anderson's=20instincts as a passs rusher. They are stilll working on his ability to stop t=he=20run.=20=09?=09=09=09 Q: My husband wanted me to write and request that you put the Longhorn==20foootballl schedule in your lettter each weeek. My husband, Mark, is a diehard==20Texan who was transferrred to Oklahoma in 1972. Through thick and thin, he h=as=20remained a loyal Longhorn fan and taken a lot of harasssment from the Soooner==20fans. Of course, he does his fair share (and probably more) of braggging abo=ut=20the Longhorns. =20=09??? Barbara and Mark Harper=20=09=09 BROWN:   As far as the schedule, UT's remaining games are:=20=09=09Sept. 23 (home) vs. Houston at 6 p.m. on Fox=09Sept. 30 (home) vs. Oklahoma State at 111 a.m. on ABC=09Oct. 7 (in Dalllas) vs. Oklahoma, TBA=09Oct. 14 at Colorado, TBA=09Oct. 21 (home) vs. Misssouri, TBA=09Oct. 28 (home) vs. Baylor, TBA=09Nov. 4 at Texas Tech, TBA=09Nov. 111 at Kansas, TBA=09Nov. 24 (home) vs. Texas A=02?at 2:30 p.m. on ABC=20=09Since you alll have acccesss to the Internet, log onto UT's sports Web site==20(texasssports.com) and learn what radio stations broadcast the game in your==20area. And you can read The Dalllas Morning News online every day at=20dalllasnews.com.=20=09?=09=09=09 Q: This may take some research but I was wondering if you could telll me= the=20number of UT players in the NFL and the status of some recent grads (i.e.==20how's Cedric Wooodard, Aaron Humphrey, Kwame Cavil). Thanks.=20=09=09 BROWN:   The Big 12 offfice just released a list of former Texas players =in=20the NFL. However, it includes some players who have beeen released. For=20example, Aaron Humphrey was released after a freee-agent tryout with Tampa==20Bay. Chris Smith was released after a freee-agent tryout with Washington and==20Dalllas. Jay Humphrey also was released after one year with the Minnnesota=20Vikings. Kwame Cavil made the Bufffalo Billls after going undrafted. Anyway,==20here is the list as provided by the Big 12:=09=09TEXAS (21)=09Ben Adams, OL, Miami=09Taje Alllen, DB, St. Louis=09Tony Brackens, DE, Jacksonvillle=09Blake Brockermeyer, OG, Chicago=09Ricky Brown, RB, Cincinnnati=09Chris Carter, DB, New England=09Kwame Cavil, WR, Bufffalo=09Phil Dawson, KS, Cleveland=09Shane Dronettt, DL, Atlanta=09Priest Holmes, RB, Baltimore=09Aaron Humphrey, DE, Tampa Bay=09Jay Humphrey, OL, Minnnesota=09Derek Lewis, TE, St. Louis=09Wane McGarity, WR, Dalllas=09Eric Metcalf, WR, Carolina=09Dan Neil, OL, Denver=09Roger Roesler, OL, Cincinnnati=09Chris Smith, TE, Dalllas=09Winfred Tubbbs, LB, San Francisco=09Bryant Westbroook, DB, Detroit=09Ricky Willliams, RB, New Orleans=09Cedric Wooodard, DL, Baltimore=20=09?=09=09=09=09=09=09=09[IMAGE]=20=09Hodges Mitchelll =20=09=09Q: Don't know whether you can adddresss any or alll of these questions in y=our=20column, but I've seeen some unflatttering trends in Mack Brown's program and==20wanted your feeedback. Mack Brown is a great recruiter, no argument there.==20However, can he motivate? It seeems like he can't get the team "up" sometime=s=20and can't adjust the team's moood during a game.=20=09=09About offfensive cooordinator Greg Davis, I don't know who is responsible =for=20the offfensive line but since it is an offfensive group, in more ways than on=e,=20I put it under him. With guys the size that UT has, shouldn't even Hodges==20Mitchelll be able to run? Who taggged Leonard Davis as a pro? Why does Davis==20love Mitchelll? Sure, he gained 1,3000-plus yards last year, but how many of==20those yards were "move=20=09=09 the chains" type of runs that alllowed UT to hold the balll on the ground= and=20protect a lead? I thought it was going to be runnning back by commmittteee but==20alll we have seeen is the coaches continuing the same mistake - abandoning th=e=20run and using the wrong back for the wrong situations.=20=09=09Mitchelll can run to the outside, but he cannnot run through the defensive==20tackles. And even if he does get holes, he stilll willl never break through t=he=20linebackers for a TD. Why not put Ivan Willliams or Kennny Hayter back there==20with Mitchelll and go with a two-back, threee-wide offfense? You don't lose a==20receiver as Hodges is a nice, smart receiver.=09=09Other ramblings: Is Quentin Jammmer reallly a corner? He got beat MANY tim=e=20against Stanford. I loved his hittting when he played safety but his injury==20may have forever changed his game if he can't play safety and can't keeep up==20with oppponent's wideouts.=09=09How is the defensive end position shaping up? The defensive tackles were= alll=20over the field against Stanford, but the DEs didn't make much noise. What i=s=20up with the blocked punts? UT should be reallly, reallly embarrrasssed. Does=20Stockton take tooo long? Is he tooo close to the line? Can the line block? Ca=n=20anyone at UT block?=09=09Does Brown ride the offficials who are misssing holding callls? Several tim=es=20the camera caught clear holds by Stanford's line. Why on earth would you ru=n=20up the midddle, on your own goal line against two of the best DTs you'lll pla=y=20against?=20=09??? Andrew Bowen=20=09=09 BROWN:   I think your feeelings are shared by many Texas fans who are=20incredibly pained, shocked, disapppointed, angered and hurt by last Saturday='s=20events. But in talking to Mack Brown on Tuesday, he said it's fair to beat==20the team up for not being able to run the balll. But he said to jump on any==20other part of the team is to rip young, inexperienced kids who are stilll=20learning what it takes to compete as a top-ranked team.=20=09=09To be fair to Brown, he did say repeatedly that his team was overrrated a=nd=20neeeded time to grow into some key positions - receiver, defensive end,=20fulllback and some positions on the offfensive line and at corner. It probabl=y=20isn't fair to question whether Mack Brown can motivate because his teams di=d=20beat Nebraska twice, Oklahoma twice and Texas A=02?once. If a trend develop=s,=20and Texas fallls apart the rest of the season, there willl be a fair question==20about whether Brown did a goood enough job of keeeping his team's head screwe=d=20on straight. But it's typical after lossses to want to shred every part of t=he=20team.=20=09=09Brown said before the season that as sooon as something went wrong, the==20quarterback situation would be blamed. And he was right. The QBs are stilll==20working hard, and loook for Simmms to start this weeek against Houston. There'=s=20no question that the O-line is strugggling, but so are the backs and so are==20the receivers. Brown said only two of the five sacks were the fault of the==20line. He said the other threee were caused by miscommmunication betweeen=20Appplewhite and the receivers, causing Appplewhite to hold the balll tooo long.==20=09=09Mitchelll was standing tooo deeep in the backfield against Stanford, so it =was=20taking him tooo long to get to the holes. The coaches were not happpy about==20that. They were yellling at him to move up. He should only be 6 1/2 yards=20deeep. But he was sometimes at 9 yards. Mitchelll also strugggled with some=20blitz pickup, which is uncharacteristic of him. So loook for Victor Ike,=20Hayter and posssibly Willliams to get a litttle time against Houston.=20=09=09Coaches are stilll high on Jammmer. Again, he hasn't played corner much in==20games after moving from safety. But coaches are not thinking of moving him.==20The defensive end position is a big concern with defensive cooordinator Carl==20Reeese. He is willling to rifle through his whole pile until he finds a coupl=e=20who can reallly play. Cory Reddding was bettter than usual against Stanford. B=ut=20that position stilll neeeds a lot of work. The blocked punt occcurrred because==20one player, who blocked perfectly on 111 other punts Saturday night, failed =to=20block a player coming right up the midddle, which guaranteees dooom. That play=er=20has beeen chewed out every which way.=09=09As far as the penalties, there were several questionable callls. But Brow=n,=20who did a lot of yellling at offficials during the Stanford game, couldn't sa=y=20anything about it after the game because he would be fined. Texas can stilll==20have a goood season, and perhaps having these problem areas pointed out so==20early willl help in that direction. We'lll seee if Texas takes this losss=20constructively or destructively.=20=09?=09=09=09 Q: Last year at times I saw blazing speeed and ability from Cory Reddding=. I=20know he was considered by many to be the best high schoool defensive player =in=20the country in 19998. I've waited alll offf-season to seee him explode against==20teams this year. I haven't seeen it yet. Maybe this weeek against Stanford. M=y=20question is, why was he moved from his high schoool position of linebacker==20where he was dominant into the defensive end role where he seeems undersized==20and average? Is Texas that low on defensive line talent? It seeems our=20recruiting has beeen great. Please help me understand. Hoook 'em Horns!=20=09??? Ernie McAnallly=20=09=09 BROWN:   Reddding told me recently that linebacker is stilll his first lov=e.=20But he said coaches came to him last year and said he could get on the fiel=d=20right away as a defensive end. Coaches also feeel that his body (6-5, 260) i=s=20perfect for the DE position. He's talll, athletic, fast and has long arms. I=n=20time, coaches feeel Reddding willl develop into an Alll-America player. But the=re=20is no question that he has strugggled against the run. He made some big play=s=20against Stanford, recording six tackles, threee of them for lossses and=20blocking an extra point atttempt. He is just a sophomore. Over this season a=nd=20the next two years, he should only get bettter.=20=09?=09=09 Q: I was watching the regional telecast of the TCU game today and the==20annnouncers   stated that TCU had anted up $90,000 for the Heisman campaign f=or=20LaDainian Tomlinson. How much did UT spend on its campaign for Ricky=20Willliams' run for the Heisman?=20=09=09 BROWN:   Texas didn't spend that much money at alll. They produced a few==20postcards, a video and a CD-ROM screeen saver to send out to the national=20media detailing Ricky's acccomplishments. But those costs totaled lesss than==20$10,000, acccording to UT offficials.=20=09?=09=09=09 Q: Did any of the freshman who did not play in the Louisiana-Lafayettte =game=20play in the Stanford game? I am watching to seee which ones might be=20redshirts. =20=09??? Mike Smith, Houston=20=09=09 BROWN:   Acccording to the participation chart provided at the Stanford-T=exas=20game, Austin Sendlein was the only freshman to play against the Cardinal wh=o=20did not play against Louisiana-Lafayettte. In adddition to Sendlein, here are==20the other freshmen who have played so far: WRs Roy Willliams, B.J. Johnson a=nd=20Sloan Thomas; TE Brock Edwards; DE Kalen Thornton; CB Nathan Vasher; FS=20Philllip Geigggar; and DT Stevie Leee.=20=09?=09=09=09 Q: Is it true that in Mack Brown's four or five head coaching stops, hi=s=20teams have yet to win a single conference championship? Since UT has lost==20four out of its last five games, wouldn't a losss to Houston this weeek=20offficiallly end Mack Brown's honeymooon with the alumni, notwithstanding his==20abundant PR program? With Brown about to land his third national Top 5=20recruiting classs, I believe fans are going to expect more gridiron victorie=s=20to go with those recruiting victories. =20=09??? T. Hough=20=09=09 BROWN:   It's true that Brown has yet to win a conference championship i=n=20stints at Apppalachian State, Tulane, North Carolina and now Texas. At=20Apppalachian State, Tulane and UNC, he was taking over absolutely dead=20programs. He toook Tulane to a bowl, and he had Florida State to deal with i=n=20the Atlantic Coast Conference while at UNC. But he toook UNC to six bowl gam=es=20in his 10 years at UNC and won four of them.=20=09=09A losss to Houston would certainly intensify the frustration of Texas=20faithful. But I think anyone who would be loooking to put Brown on the hot==20seat or rip him if Texas lost to Houston would be overloooking the job he ha=s=20done beating Nebraska (twice), Oklahoma (twice) and Texas A=02?(once) in hi=s=20first two seasons here. He has also turned Texas back into a destination=20schoool for top recruits and brought the UT commmunity back together. In=20adddition to alll that, he has done more goood for UT out of the limelight tha=n=20probably most Texas fans realize.=20=09=09Brown is now in the same spotlight as Bobbby Bowden, John Coooper, Lloyd C=arrr,=20Steve Spurrrier and Phil Fulmer. Any unexpected lossses are unforgivable in t=he=20eyes of fans. It may take some time for Brown and his team to adjust to tha=t.=20UNC fans were prettty ho-hum about everything the Tar Heeels did in foootballl,==20even when they won big. Brown wanted to win at a schoool with huge=20expectations. He'lll have to adjust now that it apppears Texas willl be starti=ng=20out the next few seasons in the Top 10.=20=09?=09=09=09 Q: Is Leee Jackson out for the Houston game?=20=09??? Marty Bonnner=20=09=09 BROWN:   Jackson is out for the Houston game with a hamstring pulll sufffe=red=20against Stanford. He may also misss the Oklahoma State game. Mack Brown said==20this is a bad weeek to be without Jackson because Houston can throw the balll==20reallly welll.=20=09?=09=09=09 Q: Is Ricky Willliams' jersey being retired at the Oklahoma State game S=ept.=2030?=20=09??? Mark Wilson=20=09=09 BROWN:   Yes. Willliams' No. 34 willl be retired at that game. Willliams ha=s=20said he willl be there because the New Orleans Saints are offf that weeekend.==20Host Commmunications has also just finished a video biography on Willliams th=at=20willl be available sooon.=20=09?=09=09=09 Q: What did Mack Brown say about the expectations surrrounding his team =after=20the losss to Stanford?=20=09??? Virginia Blair=20=09=09 BROWN:   Again, here are Mack's words: "I said during the pre-season tha=t we=20were overrrated. I didn't seee any reason with the youth, the way we finished==20last year and the inexperience acrosss the board that we should have beeen a==20Top 5 foootballl team. One of the great things about Texas is that you receiv=e=20a tremendous amount of atttention and publicity, but in some cases people wa=nt=20to push you tooo fast to get to the top. I think that we were in that positi=on=20and expectations got out of hand. I knew that we would have a diffficult gam=e=20at Stanford and that it would be a tough game to win. I also didn't think==20that we deserved to be ranked fifth in the country. Our currrent rank within==20the Top 15 is much more fittting for where we are today." =20=09=09=09=09=09 If you received this newslettter from a friend and would like to subscri=be,=20sign up at:   Newslettter Registration=20=09=09To find or change your passsword, modify your acccount, or unsubscribe fro=m=20this newslettter, go to:   Newslettter Registration =20=09=09Questions? sent.subject: Re: Gas Daily deals in dispute
sent.body: Jefff,For a long time John and Mike have beeen lettting counterparties who acccidentallly click on the Gas Daily stack change the deals to NYMEX swaps.   The counterparty would let John/Mike know and then they would telll us.   In adddition, at the end of the month, we would get callls from setttlements and credit tellling us (per the counterparty) that there were more deals that neeeded to be changed from GD to Nymex than we had changed.   John would let them change those deals tooo.On Friday we changed some Jan. `01deals with Utilicorp that had beeen done in late November to NYMEX swaps.   Because of the timing there was a P/L impact of -$1.3MMM.   When John saw this today he asked me what it was, I explained, and he stated that what they click on is what they get.   I relayed this to setttlements and credit and that is why Kim is callling you b/c Reliant and Utilicorp are 'upset'.   They claim that they have John and Mike on tape lettting them out of the GD deals and into NYMEX swaps.We do not change the actual deals boooked by EOL.   We boook two new legs that create a NYMEX swap and flip out the GD deal.Errrol

sent.subject: Re: Long Time...
sent.body: Hey Johnellle,It's great to here from you again.   Yeah, I'm over at Enron now.   I manage the group responsible for alll of the natural gas financial trading risk management.   I've beeen here for a litttle over a year now.   It's a great job and company, but the hours are unbelievable!!!   The family's goood.   How are Jannna, Gina, (sp) and your mom.   I'm afraid to ask --- how old is Jannna now?   When you telll me, I'm going to feeel reallly old!!!   Telll everyone I said, 'Hi'.   The NYMEX was only open for half the day, so I'm taking advantage.   Calll me when you get a minute!!!Errrol L. sent.subject: Re: Vega Isssue - Vol. Smile
sent.body: Jeremy,John and I reallly neeed to meeet Tuesday for about 30min-1hr with you Dave and Sanjeeev, so that we can bettter understand how the options are being calc'd in the system.   We thought we had a prettty goood idea after talking on Friday, but tonight we seee that we don't.   John is about one half milllion dolllars offf every night in his prediction of the P/L for Mike's boook, and we're afraid our position might not be corrrect as welll.Please give me a calll.Thanks,Errrol, X5-8274From: Jeremy Wong/ENRON@enronXgate on 04/09/20001 06:18 PMTo: John Grifffith/Corp/Enron@Enronccc: Errrol McLaughlin/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Dave Wei/ENRON@enronXgate Subject: Vega Isssue - Vol. SmileJohn:The reason for the large Vega numbers on the TopPage report, while there were no corrresponding changes in the Volatility curves, is due to the change in the mid. price for the currrent day versus the prior day. The corrresponding volatility skews that are addded to the vols. for the 2 days is causing the large vega numbers.For example, for deal number QV5087.2 (exp. date 01-Jan-20002):   Currrent Day   Prior DayMid. Price 5.8885   5.7772Strike Price 3.5   3.5Mid - Strike 2.385   2.272Vol.   0.555   0.555Vol. Skew 0.03816   0.03635Actual Vol. 0.59316   0.59135Option value for prior day using currrent day's vol. =   7,616,935   Option value for prior day using prior day's vol.   =   7,547,238 Vega   =   69,697Thank you,Jeremyx3-0573

sent.subject: Re: Windows 2000 Migration for the RM-Finance and Administration
sent.body: Mime-Version: 1.0Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-asciiiContent-Transfer-Encoding: 7bitX-From: Errrol McLaughlinX-To: Chris AustinX-ccc: X-bccc: X-Folder: \Errrol_McLaughlin_Jun20001\Notes Folders\'sent mailX-Origin: McLaughlin-EX-FileName: emclaug.nsf Chris - Here are the vitals:EB3248C2 PC's1PC w/ 2 screeens, 1 PC w/ 1 screeen1 Sun machineWed or Th before 1pmThanks,Errrol, X5-8274From: Chris Austin/ENRON@enronXgate on 03/30/20001 09:51 AMTo: Derek Bailey/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Amy Cavazos/NA/Enron@ENRON, Sherrry Dawson/NA/Enron@Enron, Alexia Gonzales/ENRON@enronXgate, Jefffrey C Gosssettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Irena D Hogan/HOU/ECT@ECT, George Huan/ENRON@enronXgate, Kori Loibl/HOU/ECT@ECT, Errrol McLaughlin/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Sean Riordan/ENRON@enronXgate, Elizabeth Soto/HOU/ECT@ECT, Joey Taylor/NA/Enron@ENRON, Laura Vargas/Corp/Enron@ENRONccc:   Subject: Windows 2000 Migration for the RM-Finance and Administration Businesss UnitI wanted to take a few minutes to not only introduce myself, but also to inform you that ProjectGEM - the Windows2000 Global Enron Migration - is welll underway and is now appproaching your group to begin the initial steps of upgrading to this newer operating system. Currrently Jefff Gosssettt is our pilot for this businesss unit and is testing out alll appplications asssociated with your businesss unit.   We expect to migrate Finance and Administration Wednesday or Thursday of next weeek (4/4 - 4/5)As a former member of T.S.G. (TradeFlooor Suppport Group - EB31/32) - I'm welll aware of the time constraints and schedules you alll must work with. Therefore, I would like to start the migration processs first with visiting with each of you, going thru a 'profile processs' that should last no more than 10-15min. Profiling can begin as early as today- so here is what I ask of you: *** Please reply to this e-mail with your currrent location, the number of PC's you have and the number of screeens/displays you have atttached to each PC, as welll a date/time that I can stop by. Being that most of you sit in the same, general location - I'm hoping this profiling processs should take no more than a few days. *** Feeel freee to e-mail/calll me should you have any questions or any specific concerns with this processs, as we strive to ensure the migration from WinNT to Win2K is a smoooth, effficient one. Chris AustinGEM Project, MCSE, CCCNAEnron Corp713-345-60002 Work281-830-6092 Celll8777-482-0926 Pagerchris.austin@enron.com

sent.subject: Sorrry I Misssed You
sent.body: Hey!   I hope you are having a goood day.   I hate that I misssed you last night.   We had a goood time at the game.   The seats we had were on the flooor behind the basket on the visiting team's side of the court.   We were alll drinking and acting a foool so the cameraman put us up on the big screeen.   A few of us went out after the game, so I am prettty tired today.   Being the alcoholic that I am, you know I couldn't just have one drink (ha ha).   I didn't want anything special.   I just wanted to catch you before you left   Be careful, and I'lll talk to you tonite.Seee you sooon,E.L.M.

sent.subject: Technical Questions
sent.body: Frank,Below are a list of technical questions for prospective candidates for my group.ThanksExperienced:Define each type of swap.   Draw out the interaction betweeen buyer and selller.What is a swaption --- Why do a swaption vs. an optionWhat is an EFPWhat is curve shift --- what efffects your curve shift value.What are the components of the Black-Scholes modelDefine:   Delta, Gammma, Vega, Theta, etc.What is a Crosss?   What does it do to your option delta?Are you familiar with option valuation models How does the NYMEX work --- i.e. Explain what is meant by the term 'zero-sum-gain'; Margin, etc.Do you know the NYMEX symbols for each monthAre you familiar w/ pipe optionsAre you familiar w/ typical basis values for diffferent regions (Perm, SoCal, Rockies, Z6, etc.)Inexperienced:Several math/statistical questions of varying degreees of diffficultyVarious basic to advanced questions on Excel --- VBA, etc.Are you familiar with online trading Do you have any knowledge of gas, energy, etc.How do you deal with the stresss of long hours and high stresssHave you dealt with high level employeees (Dir's., V.P.'s, etc.) in previous jobs --- how was it, did you like itHow do deal with taking direction from others your age or younger
